data.title: History of St. Francis Assisi Church, Tallur
data.meta_description: Catholic Time - A News & Information Portal
data.text:
St. Francis Assisi Church, Tallur (Vijayrebello4u, CC BY-SA 4.0, via Wikimedia Commons)

About Church

St. Francis Assisi a catholic church in Tallur was originally established in 1934. It was renovated during Fr. Sunil Veigas's service into a star-shaped temple and was inaugurated in May 2016. The church has jurisdiction over Tallur, Uppinakudru, Hemmady, Devalkunda, and Hattiangadi villages. The church is located in central part of Tallur of Kundapur Taluk.

History

Before 1929 there were no prayer centers for Christians and so the devotees from and around Tallur throng into Holy Rosary Catholic Church in the town to offer prayers. Later Rev Fr. Peter Remegias D’Souza in 1928 purchased land in Tallur and simultaneously constructed a small hut. There was a plea from the devotees to set up a separate church at Tallur. After this demand was approved in the parish level meeting, the church was established in 1934 and got its first ever priest in the form of Fr Edward Lobo. The Christian community then constructed a new church in 1959.

New star-shaped church building

The foundation stone for the proposed new building was laid on 20 October 2012 by Udupi Bishop Gerald Isaac Lobo during the tenure of 19th parish priest Fr Sunil Veigas. ‘Shilpi’ architects based in Kerala designed this church building. From outside this building looks like a star. The church has an entrance from three sides through similar doors. The three-side doors to the building provide the experience of entering a star.

Inauguration

The church was inaugurated by Most Rev Dr Gerald Isaac Lobo, Bishop of Udupi Diocese on 12 May 2016. He also offered the first Eucharistic service in the new church in the presence of Fr Anil D’Souza, Dean of Kundapur Deanery; Fr Valerian Mendonca, Chancellor of Udupi Diocese and parish priest of Barkur church; Fr Sunil Veigas, parish Priest , other priests, nuns and a large number of faithful.

An honoring function was held after the holy mass. Bishop Gerald Isaac Lobo presided over the function. Vinay Kumar Sorake, Minister for Urban Development and District minister in-charge; Fr Anil D’Souza, Dean of Kundapur Deanery and others attended as chief guests for the function. The stage programme was followed by a fellowship meal.

This church building including presbytery has been built at a cost of over Rs 3.5 crore and has enough space to accommodate 600 devotees.

Parish Priests who have served in the parish :

Fr Edward Lobo (1934 - first parish priest)

Fr Valerian Mendonca (1986 - 1987 : Eccl. Administrator)

Fr Francis Cornelio (1987 - 1994)

Fr Benjamin D’Souza (2001 - 2009)

Fr Sunil Joseph Veigas (2009 - 2016)

Fr John Mendonca (2016 - 2022 )

Fr Edwin Dsouza (from 2022 onwards)
